parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of nodes to return in the result-set.

parameters.name: organizationID
parameters.description:
ID of the organization for which to filter on, when left blank the
response will return all gateways to which the user has access to.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search on name or gateway MAC (optional).

put.summary: Update updates the gateway matching the given mac address.

get.summary:
StreamFrameLogs streams the uplink and downlink frame-logs for the given gateway ID.
Notes:
  * These are the raw LoRaWAN frames and this endpoint is intended for debugging only.
  * This endpoint does not work from a web-browser.
GetLastPing returns the last emitted ping and gateways receiving this ping.
GetStats lists the gateway stats given the query parameters.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
Aggregation interval.  One of "second", "minute", "hour", "day", "week",
"month", "quarter", "year".  Case insensitive.

get.summary: Get returns the gateway for the requested mac address.

delete.summary: Delete deletes the gateway matching the given mac address.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of nodes to return in the result-set.

parameters.name: organizationID
parameters.description:
ID of the organization for which to filter on, when left blank the
response will return all gateways to which the user has access to.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search on name or gateway MAC (optional).

commonLocationSource.description:
- UNKNOWN: Unknown.
 - GPS: GPS.
 - CONFIG: Manually configured.
 - GEO_RESOLVER_TDOA: Geo resolver (TDOA).
 - GEO_RESOLVER_RSSI: Geo resolver (RSSI).
 - GEO_RESOLVER_GNSS: Geo resolver (GNSS).
 - GEO_RESOLVER_WIFI: Geo resolver (WIFI).

organizationID.description:
Organization ID to which the gateway belongs.
This can't be changed after creating the gateway.

discoveryEnabled.description: Set to true to enable gateway discovery.

networkServerID.description: Network-server ID on which the gateway is provisioned.

boards.description:
Gateway boards configuration (optional).
This is (currently) only needed when the gateway supports the fine-timestamp
and you you would like to add the FPGA ID to the gateway meta-data or would
like LPWAN Server to decrypt the fine-timestamp.

fpgaID.description: FPGA ID of the gateway (HEX encoded) (optional).

altitude.description: Altitude of the gateway in meters.

rxPacketsReceivedOK.description: Packets received by the gateway that passed the CRC check.

txPacketsReceived.description: Packets received by the gateway for transmission.

totalCount.description: Total number of nodes available within the result-set.

altitude.description: Altitude of the gateway in meters.

gwCRCStatus.description:
- NO_CRC: No CRC.
 - BAD_CRC: Bad CRC.
 - CRC_OK: CRC OK.

delay.description:
Delay (duration).
The delay will be added to the gateway internal timing, provided by the context object.

gatewayID.description:
Gateway ID.
Deprecated: replaced by gateway_id in DownlinkFrame.

board.description: The board identifier for emitting the frame.

antenna.description: The antenna identifier for emitting the frame.

timing.description: Timing defines the downlink timing to use.

context.description:
Gateway specific context.
In case of a Class-A downlink, this contains a copy of the uplink context.

gwDownlinkTiming.description:
- IMMEDIATELY: Send the downlink immediately.
 - DELAY: Send downlink at the given delay (based on provided context).
 - GPS_EPOCH: Send at given GPS epoch value.

aesKeyIndex.description: AES key index used for encrypting the fine timestamp.

encryptedNS.description: Encrypted 'main' fine-timestamp (ns precision part of the timestamp).

gwFineTimestampType.description:
- NONE: No fine-timestamp available.
 - ENCRYPTED: Encrypted fine-timestamp.
 - PLAIN: Plain fine-timestamp.

time.description: RX time (only set when the gateway has a GPS module).

timeSinceGPSEpoch.description: RX time since GPS epoch (only set when the gateway has a GPS module).

uplinkID.description:
Uplink ID (UUID bytes).
Unique and random ID which can be used to correlate the uplink across multiple logs.
